text: Archopterus is an extinct genus of eurypterid from the family Adelophthalmidae. It contains one species called A. anjiensis and is from the Wenchang Formation in Zhejiang, China. == Description == Archopterus likely fed on small mollusks, crustaceans and worms. == Related pages == * Orcanopterus * Pterygotus * Bassipterus * Megarachne * Jaekelopterus == References == Category:Chelicerata Category:Animals of Asia Category:Fossils Category:China
title: Archopterus
